item.title: Christopher add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "I have observed this in my experience of slavery, - that whenever my condition was improved, instead of its increasing my contentment, it only increased my desire to be free, and set me to thinking of plans to gain my freedom. I have found that, to make a contented slave, it is necessary to make a thoughtless one. It is necessary to darken his moral and mental vision, and, as far as possible, to annihilate the power of reason. He must be able to detect no inconsistencies in slavery; he must be made to feel that slavery is right; and he can be brought to that only when he ceased to be a man." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Christopher add a quote by LYSANDER SPOONER
item.description: "A man is no less a slave because he is allowed to choose a new master once in a term of years." -- LYSANDER SPOONER
